sentence.Network_en: It taught only materialism, the gospel of mammon.
sentence.Network_cn: 它只是宣扬金钱至上的物欲主义。

sentence.Network_en: It is not every day that one meets a business-person who is not obsessed with Mammon.
sentence.Network_cn: 不贪财的生意人可遇不可求。

sentence.Network_en: It was possible to serve God and Mammon at the same time.
sentence.Network_cn: 敬上帝与拜财神可以并行不悖.

encyclopedia.content: 恶魔 玛蒙(Mammon)——喜爱金银财宝的恶魔 Mammon也被称为Amaimon，在叙利亚语中有着“富有”和“金钱”的含义。这位恶魔出现在《旧约圣经》与《新约圣经》之间的年代，在《玛太福音书》中曾有关于他的描绘：“一个人不能侍奉两个主人，热爱一方则必须憎恶另一方。如果你敬爱神，那么就不能执着于财富！” 玛蒙是勾起人类“金钱欲”的恶魔，其势力是在中世纪以后才逐渐著名起来。这主要是因为在古代财富的集中化并不明显，但到了

entry.def: You can use Mammon to refer to money and business activities if you want to show your disapproval of people who think that becoming rich is the most important thing in life.

example.ex: It is not every day that one meets a business-person who is not obsessed with Mammon.
example.tran: 不贪财的生意人可遇不可求。

means.word_mean: 1. wealth regarded as an evil influence
